medical_history.chief_complaint: Subjective fevers, rigors, cough, and lower extremity edema.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with subjective fevers and rigors, possibly related to a delayed obinutuzumab reaction. The patient also developed a cough productive of white sputum and bilateral lower extremity edema over the course of several days. Initially, he experienced labile temperatures, ranging from 95 to 100.8 at home, and exhibited new lower extremity edema compared to two weeks ago. There were intermittent wheezing episodes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: CLL/SLL, thrombocytopenia treated for ITP, s/p permanent pacemaker, chronic kidney disease (CKD), hypothyroidism, gastroesophageal reflux, valvular heart disease, history of skin cancers, osteoporosis, benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), and tuberculosis exposure in distant past.
medical_history.family_history: His mother died of a stroke, his father died from tuberculosis, his brother died from leukemia, and his daughter has schizophrenia. No family history of dementia or other psychiatric illness was mentioned.
